frameDefinitions: An Entity is declared to exist, generally irrespective of its position or even the possibility of its position being specified.
An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
A Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an Evaluee who has committed an Offense.
During a court appearance, a Sentence, generally a punishment, is imposed on the Convict by a Court, usually represented by a judge.
An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.

These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
frameExamples: Finally, Poland ceased to <t>exist</t> as a state for hundreds of years.
He <t>atoned</t> for his sin with good works.
The judge <t>sentenced</t> Martha Stewart to 2 years in prison for insider trading.
His <t>punishment</t> of the prisoners was too harsh.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist.
A time at which the entity is in existence.
Where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.
The <fen>Agent</fen> has committed a <fen>Wrong</fen> and is making <fen>Amends</fen>.
<fen>Wrong</fen> identifies the act committed by the <fen>Agent</fen> for which <fen>Amends</fen> are made.
<fen>Amends</fen> marks expressions that indicate what the <fen>Agent</fen> does to compensate for the <fen>Wrong</fen> that was committed.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> atones for the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> expiates the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The <fen>Judge</fen> holds the <fen>Evaluee</fen> responsible for the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is subject to the judgment of the <fen>Judge</fen> for having committed the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Offense</fen> is the illicit or unpleasant act committed by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is given a <fen>Sentence</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
The <fen>Court</fen> imposes a <fen>Sentence</fen> on a <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Sentence</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Convict</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
This role denotes the duration of the sentence.
The illegal action of which the <fen>Convict</fen> has been found guilty and for which they are punished.
The Time when the <fen>Convict</fen> is sentenced.
The location of the sentencing <fen>Court</fen>.
<fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is typically expressed as Object.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Agent</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person doing the rewarding or punishing.
The reward or punishment given to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Syria</fex> has atoned for its support of Iraq.
Smithers is atoning <fex>for his misspent youth</fex>.
He atoned for his sin <fex>with good works</fex>.
Won't you forgive me <fex>for keeping it a secret</fex>?
Judge Duncan sentenced <fex>Marty</fex> to five years under house detention.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> sentenced Marty to five years under house detention.
Judge Duncan sentenced Marty <fex>to five years under house detention</fex>.
Tom will recieve a <t>sentence</t> <fex>of five years</fex>.
A pet store owner was sentenced <fex>for illegaly smuggling protected reptiles</fex>.
He will be sentenced <fex>at a later date</fex>.
Biancaniello will be sentenced <fex>in San Francisco</fex> later this summer.
The boss rewarded <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
<fex>Jake's</fex> rewards to his best workers were very generous.
If a person be guilty of impiety let him be punished <fex>with death</fex>.
